item.title: Where does the Wikimedia Foundation spend its money?
item.description:
üèñ on Twitter

‚ÄúIf you use Wikipedia, you‚Äôve seen pop-ups like this. If you‚Äôre like me, you may have donated as a result. Wikipedia is an amazing website, and the appeals seem heartfelt. But I‚Äôve now learnt the money isn‚Äôt going where I thought...‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/echetus/status/1579776106034757633

item.title: The culinary culture that is Glasgow
item.description:
John McCarthy on Twitter

‚ÄúThis week. I hit my lowest culinary point after a couple of cans. In Glasgow, there‚Äôs a pizza vending machine, in the wall of an abandoned shop. It‚Äôs a curious thing. It MUST be bad. But how bad??? Let‚Äôs find out.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/JohnGeeMcCarthy/status/1578696366821240832?t=FlDNzFgNFZcgKY3TkOuvrA&s=19

item.title: Five Things You Need to Know to Start Your Day
Gives an economic history, but no new ideas for actually moving towards utopia

Central banks are risking the best jobs market in a generation
The new rules for business in a post-neoliberal world
The marked contrast in pandemic outcomes between Japan and the United States
The Truss revolution is eating itself
Even After $100 Billion, Self-Driving Cars Are Going Nowhere
Davis Kedrosky
item.description:
Davis Kedrosky on Twitter

‚ÄúAre autocracies better at delivering on growth promises? Not really‚Äîa new paper soon out in the JPE argues that the GDP stats are very extremely fake.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/dkedrosky/status/1576233656749674496

source: Best of Twitter - September 26- October 8, 2022

item.title: Davis Kedrosky
item.description:
Davis Kedrosky on Twitter

‚ÄúRaw GDP figures suggest that autocracies grew by 76%, not 147%, over 2002-2021, much more in line with the democracies, who barely lied at all. Only 1 of the top 10 fastest-growing countries on raw data was ‚Äúfree‚Äù, versus 5 of the top 10 when adjusted for satellite imagery.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/dkedrosky/status/1576233668158271488

source: Best of Twitter - September 26- October 8, 2022

Flo Crivello on Twitter

‚ÄúLanguage models have become so good that our benchmarks can‚Äôt keep up. It‚Äôs like you were looking to measure the rapidly rising temperature in a room, but your themormeters break faster than you can improve them.‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/Altimor/status/1575179505219543040

item.title: nearcyan
item.description:
nearcyan on Twitter

‚Äúself-programming AI: ‚Äúa code-generating language model with the ability to modify its own source code is created and then queried to generate new source code for itself; a new iteration of the model is initialized and trained, and the cycle continues‚Äù https://t.co/TD8sfbssJu‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/nearcyan/status/1576620734146756609

source: Best of Twitter - September 26- October 8, 2022

item.title: nearcyan
item.description:
nearcyan on Twitter

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs always nice to look at the benchmarks used in these papers e.g. GSM8K is a dataset of math questions that require 2-8 steps to solve: https://t.co/7QgkB7ewo9 GPT-3 got 10% of them correct, then 41% correct with https://t.co/jimKRcfm6M we‚Äôre now at 82% with the above model!‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/nearcyan/status/1576665925687730176

source: Best of Twitter - September 26- October 8, 2022

item.title: Alexey Guzey
item.description:
Alexey Guzey on Twitter

‚Äúbeen using gpt-3+copilot heavily recently--both surprisingly useful at amplifying my thought+action. thinking broadly now about ways ai could make humans think&ideate better+faster, make better decisions, empower us in general. lmk if you‚Äôre thinking/tinkering around this stuff‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/alexeyguzey/status/1577696616512770065
